document_metadata.subject: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to Meet With Top GOP Lawmakers

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability

content_analysis.emotional_indicators: Concern from lawmakers, defensive from tech companies
content_analysis.purpose: To report on upcoming congressional meetings with Google CEO and growing regulatory scrutiny of big tech companies
content_analysis.significance: Documents early stages of major regulatory scrutiny that would eventually lead to antitrust investigations and increased tech regulation

issues_mentioned: Alleged political bias in search results

notable_quotes: "Google has a lot of questions to answer about reports of bias in its search results, violations of user privacy, anticompetitive behavior and business dealings with repressive regimes like China" - Kevin McCarthy

"I look forward to meeting with members on both sides of the aisle, answering a wide range of questions, and explaining our approach. These meetings will continue Google's long history of engaging with Congress" - Sundar Pichai

"The administration also could release its own set of principles for online privacy this week. They could further fuel talk of broad online privacy legislationâ€”something the tech companies have successfully avoided for years."
red_flags_and_concerns: Allegations of anticompetitive behavior by Google
Concerns about business dealings with China's censored internet
Political manipulation accusations from both sides
Growing bipartisan support for tech regulation
